segment.documentation: BGM, A segment by which the sender must uniquely identify the message by means of its type, number and, when necessary, its function.
DTM, A segment specifying general dates and, when relevant, times related to the whole message. The segment must be included at least once to identify the message date.
CUX, A segment identifying the currencies required e.g. the currency of the reimbursement amount. A rate of exchange may be given to convert a reference currency into a target currency.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments giving references and where necessary, their dates, relating to the whole message e.g. contract number, import and/or export license number, reservation number.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.
DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying the parties and any associated information.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying names and addresses of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions relevant to the message. Identification of the manufacturer and repair centre is mandatory for the message. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party identification should be specified e.g. the manufacturer and repair centre are known to each other, thus only the coded identification is required.
FII, A segment identifying the financial institution (e.g. bank) and relevant account numbers for reimbursement purposes.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments giving references only relevant to the specified party rather than the Product Service.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.
DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments giving contact details of the specific person or department within the party identified.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department, and their function, to whom communications should be directed.
COM, A segment to identify a communications type and number for the contact specified. 4.1.2 Detail section Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments providing details of the individual service claim or report.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment to identify a claim document for reimbursement or report of service, issued by a service or repair centre.
DTM, A segment specifying date, time and/or period details relating to the claim.
STS, A segment identifying the status of the claim in a response, and the reason for that status.
MOA, A segment specifying amounts relating to the claim.

FTX, A segment with free text information relating to the claim, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: SG12-SG14 A group of segments providing identification and a description of the line items within the group. This segment group may be repeated to give sub-line details.

segment.documentation: LIN, A segment identifying the line item by the line number and additionally identifying the product being serviced or repaired.
PIA, A segment providing either additional identification to the product specified in the line item segment (e.g. model number) or any substitute product identification.
IMD, A segment to further describe the product being serviced or repaired. This segment should be used for products that cannot be fully identified by a product code or article number.
QTY, A segment identifying the product quantities e.g. the quantity of products repaired, serviced or replaced under a product recall.
DTM, A segment specifying date, time and/or period details relating to the line item only, e.g. date of failure of product.
ALI, A segment indicating special conditions related to the total claim e.g. Home Repair or Repair Centre Repair
GIR, A segment providing sets of related identification numbers for a line item e.g. attached equipment, engine numbers, chassis number and transmission number for a vehicle.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments giving references and where necessary, their dates, relating to the line item.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.
DTM, A segment specifying the date/time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments identifying the parties with associated information relevant to the line item only.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying names and addresses of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions relevant to the line item. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party identification should be specified e.g. the seller, the retailer and repairer of the product may be known to each other, thus only the coded identification is required, but the Owner's address details may have to be clearly specified, preferably in structured format.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments for giving references only relevant to the specified party rather than the whole line item.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.
DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments giving contact details of the specific person or department within the party identified.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department, and their function, to whom communications should be directed.
COM, A segment to identify a communications type and number for the contact specified.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments providing product characteristic details.

segment.documentation: CCI, A segment to identify characteristics related to the problem, service or repair of the product e.g. defects, repair characteristics.
CAV, A segment to specify common product characteristic by value in either coded form or in free format.

FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional characteristic information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments specifying allowances and charges for the Product Service identified in the line item.

segment.documentation: ALC, A segment identifying the charge or allowance and, where necessary, its calculation sequence.
QTY, A segment identifying the pertinent quantities to the allowances and charges, e.g. the quantity of labour hours
MOA, A segment identifying the monetary amount for the allowance or charge.
RTE, A segment specifying the rate per unit and the basis for calculation.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments specifying tax related information for the allowance or charge.

segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying the tax type, category and rate, or exemption, related to the allowance or charge.
MOA, A segment specifying the tax amount for the allowance or charge.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments identifying hierarchical connections from the item given in the line item segment to lower levelled items. This segment group will provide details of the replaced or repaired parts.

segment.documentation: HYN, This segment identifies hierarchical connections from the product identified in the line item to lower level items. This segment which starts the group will be repeated for each part which was repaired or replaced.
PIA, A segment providing additional identification of the part which was repaired or replaced.
IMD, A segment to further describe the part being repaired or replaced. This segment should be used for parts that cannot be fully identified by a part code or article number.
QTY, A segment identifying the quantity of parts repaired or replaced for the product.
ALI, A segment indicating special conditions related to the part identified at this level.
PRI, A segment to specify the price of the replaced part

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments giving references and where necessary, their dates, relating to the replaced or repaired part.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.
DTM, A segment specifying the date/time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments specifying allowances and charges for the Product Service identified in the line item.

segment.documentation: ALC, A segment identifying the charge or allowance and, where necessary, its calculation sequence.
QTY, A segment identifying the pertinent quantities to the allowances and charges, e.g. the quantity of labour hours
MOA, A segment identifying the monetary amount for the allowance or charge.
RTE, A segment specifying the rate per unit and the basis for calculation.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments specifying tax related information for the allowance or charge.

segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying the tax type, category and rate, or exemption, related to the allowance or charge.
MOA, A segment specifying the tax amount for the allowance or charge.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments providing product characteristic details.

segment.documentation: CCI, A segment to identify characteristics of the problems and service or repair of the part e.g. defects, repair characteristics
CAV, A segment to specify common part characteristics by value in either coded form or in free format.

FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional characteristic information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually. 4.1.3 Summary section Information to be provided in the Summary section:
UNS, A service segment placed at the start of the summary section to avoid segment collision.
CNT, A segment by which control totals may be provided by the sender for checking by the receiver.
MOA, A segment giving the total amounts for the message such as total claim/reimbursement amount, total amount of tax

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segments specifying tax totals for the message.

segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying the tax type and rate to be summarised.
MOA, A segment specifying the summary amount for the tax specified.
